summary: The Microplastics Safety Act, introduced in the Senate, directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to conduct a study on the human health impacts of exposure to microplastics in food and water. The study will identify pathways of exposure and assess impacts on children's health, the endocrine system, cancer, chronic illness, and reproductive health. The Secretary must then submit a report to Congress within a year, detailing findings, conclusions, and recommendations for action.
